body.p: The AI Positron add-on is a very useful copilot when editing in Oxygen XML Editor/Developer and Oxygen JSON Editor documents such as XSLT stylesheets, XSD, Schematron, and JSON Schema documents.

For example, when such a document is opened in Oxygen, the Development menu category contains useful actions:
Explain Code (available for XSLT, Schematron, XSD, CSS, XQuery, JSON, and JSON Schema) - generates an explanation of the code in the Chat view.
Select, for example, an XSLT template and use this action from the contextual menu or the quick assist menu. It will show an explanation in simple terms of what the XSLT template does in the chat view.
Similarly, you can choose an XSD type, a JSON Schema definition, a Schematron rule, some XQuery code, or some CSS rules, and then use the action to get an explanation of the code in the chat view.
Document Code (available for XSLT, XSD, and Schematron) - generates the documentation of the code and includes it as a comment before the current element.
Select, for example, an XSLT template and use this action to add documentation before the XSLT template explaining what it does.
Annotate Code (available for XSLT, Schematron, and XSD) - generates XML comments within the code found in the current selection, at the cursor location, or in the whole document. The generated annotations explain key concepts of the code.
You can open an XSLT document and select a template. Then, use the Annotate Code action to document the template and the code within it. The documented template will be displayed in the Chat view, allowing you to preview and accept the modifications.
Chat About Code (available for XSLT, Schematron, XSD, CSS, XQuery, JSON, and JSON Schema) - creates a new chat to start a discussion with the AI regarding the code.
Start a discussion with the AI regarding the XSLT code found in the current selection or the element content at the current cursor location. You can use the chat to improve the code, modify the generated content, or ask questions about the code.
Generate Code (available for XSLT, Schematron, XSD, CSS, XQuery, JSON, and JSON Schema) - generates code based on a specified instruction.
For example, you can generate the content of an XSLT stylesheet that will process your XML document. Just place the caret after the comment that describes what you want to generate and use the action.
You can generate specific XSLT templates or functions based on instructions. The instruction can be a selected text, in which case the text will be replaced with the generated code. Alternatively, the instruction can be the previous XML comment, in which case the generated text will be inserted after the comment.
For XSD, you can create new schema components using a description and reuse existing components from the document.
Suggest Refactoring (available for XSLT and XSD) - proposes a suggestion for refactoring the code to simplify it and make it easier to read and understand.
For instance, you can choose the content of an XSLT stylesheet with a monolithic template and execute the action. Once the action is performed, several templates will be generated, enhancing the readability and comprehension of the stylesheet.
You can select, for example, an XSLT template to be refactored and the action will simplify the code and reuse already defined templates and functions.
In addition, when moving the cursor within the document, a quick assist bulb appears in the navigation vertical stripe bar. Clicking the bulb opens a popup with available actions.
